title: Ice Ages and Milankovitch Cycles
description: A quick, practical guide to Ice Ages and Milankovitch Cycles.

hook.text: Earth has been through at least five major ice ages. We're technically still in one.

buildup.text: Serbian scientist Milutin Milankovitch proposed that orbital changes drive ice ages.

discovery.text: Earth's orbit stretches, its tilt wobbles, and its axis precesses over millennia.

twist.text: These tiny changes alter sunlight distribution enough to grow or melt ice sheets.

climax.text: Ice cores confirm his theory â€” temperature swings match orbital cycles perfectly.

punchline.text: Earth's orbit wobbles. That wobble decides whether ice covers continents.

quiz.question: What do Milankovitch cycles describe?
options: Changes in Earth's orbit that drive ice ages
